security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing markdown files with development principles and guidelines. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access beyond reading its own documentation files. The skill provides safe, read-only guidance for AI-assisted development workflows.

content.user_title: Apply Development Principles and Safety Guidelines
content.value_statement: AI coding assistants need clear principles to work safely and effectively. This skill provides development guidelines, safety rules, and VibeCoder support for non-technical users to guide AI-assisted development.
actual_capabilities: Provide development principles and safety guidelines for all tasks
Guide minimal diff-aware file editing to preserve existing code
Help read and understand repository context (README, Plans.md, AGENTS.md)
Support VibeCoders (non-technical users) with natural language guidance
Enforce safety rules like dry-run mode and protected path handling
Route requests to appropriate sub-skills based on user intent
limitations: This skill only provides guidance, it does not execute code changes itself
Safety mode enforcement depends on external configuration (claude-code-harness.config.json)
Does not provide implementation code, only principles and guidelines

prompt_templates.title: Edit Minimally

prompt_templates.title: Help VibeCoder
prompt_templates.prompt: I'm not technical. What should I say to get the AI to work on my project?

output_examples.input: How should I edit this file safely?
output: Always read the file content before making changes
Make edits in the smallest possible units
Preserve existing indentation, formatting, and comments
Check git diff after editing to verify changes
Never write entire files, use Edit tool for targeted changes

best_practices: Read file content before editing to understand the existing code structure
Apply minimal diff principles to keep changes focused and reviewable
Check git status and git diff after every change to verify modifications
anti_patterns: Using Write tool to overwrite entire files instead of using Edit for targeted changes
Mixing unrelated changes (formatting, refactoring, feature additions) in one edit
Ignoring project configuration like claude-code-harness.config.json safety settings

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It is a meta-skill containing sub-skills for different purposes.

faq.question: Does this skill make changes to my codebase?
faq.answer: No. This skill only provides guidance and principles. It does not execute code changes or access files beyond reading documentation.

faq.question: How does VibeCoder mode help non-technical users?
faq.answer: VibeCoder mode translates technical questions into simple language and provides examples of what users should say to guide the AI.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads markdown documentation files. It does not access .env files, credentials, or any user data.

faq.question: Why do I see bash command examples in the documentation?
faq.answer: These are example commands shown to the AI assistant for reference. The AI reads them to understand context, but you do not run them directly.

faq.question: How does this differ from other development skills?
faq.answer: This skill provides foundational principles and safety guidelines. Other implementation skills actually write code. This skill ensures safe, consistent workflows.
